channel.title: Technology - Los Angeles Times
channel.description: Read social media and tech articles from the L.A. Times, covering technology news, social media, apps, electronics and more technology business news.

item.title: Amazon will let shoppers try on clothes before buying
item.dc:creator: Alexa D'Angelo
item.description:
Amazon can’t provide a fitting room for trying on that new pair of jeans before purchasing them, but a new feature for Amazon Prime members is taking a crack at being the next best thing.

The company on Tuesday announced Amazon Prime Wardrobe, which will allow users who pay for the e-commerce giant’s...

item.title: Tesla car on Autopilot warned driver 7 times before fatal crash, safety regulator says
item.dc:creator: Rachel Spacek
item.description:
A Tesla car in Autopilot mode warned its driver seven times to put his hands on the steering wheel during the 40 minutes before the crash that ended his life last year, a newly released set of reports from the National Transportation Safety Board revealed.

The reports, released this week, contain...

item.title: Twitch reaches 2-year streaming rights deal for Blizzard e-sports events
item.dc:creator: Paresh Dave
item.description:
Video streaming service Twitch announced Tuesday a two-year deal with Blizzard Entertainment to become the exclusive third-party home for many of the Irvine game-maker’s e-sports events.

Blizzard Entertainment can continue to stream video game competitions on its own services, including MLG.TV...

item.title: Uber adds the option to tip drivers, and you'll pay for making them wait
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description:
Uber is enabling passengers to tip its U.S. drivers with a tap on its ride-hailing app for the first time, part of a push to recast itself as a company with a conscience and a heart.

Besides the built-in tipping option announced Tuesday, Uber is giving drivers an opportunity to make more money...

item.title: Apple points to recent Supreme Court decision to buoy its lawsuit against Qualcomm
item.dc:creator: Mike Freeman
item.description:
Apple has latched onto a recent U.S. Supreme Court ruling that restricts patent holders rights to bolster its increasingly bloody legal war against San Diego’s Qualcomm.

The iPhone maker on Tuesday amended its January lawsuit in San Diego federal court, which alleges Qualcomm illegally charges...

item.title: Historical accuracy, not a diversity push, brought 'Battlefield' playable female characters
item.dc:creator: Paresh Dave
item.description: The inclusion of the women's batallion gives a peek into the operations of DICE L.A., the 80-person unit that collaborates with offices in Sweden on the "Battlefield" franchise.

item.title: How the Amazon-Whole Foods deal could hurt — or help — Instacart
item.dc:creator: Tracey Lien
item.description: What's Instacart to do if Amazon buys Whole Foods?

item.title: Google steps up its fight against extremist and inflammatory videos
item.dc:creator: Rachel Spacek
item.description:
Months after some advertisers fled Google over concerns about ads appearing alongside YouTube videos that promote hate and extremism, the Internet giant has announced new steps aimed at tackling such content.

“There should be no place for terrorist content on our services,” Google said in a Sunday...

item.title: Silicon Valley's acquisition targets aren't just in tech anymore
item.dc:creator: Paresh Dave
item.description:
For once, the target of an extravagant tech industry acquisition wasn’t a small start-up unfamiliar outside of Silicon Valley, but a household name.

Few foresaw Amazon.com reaching an agreement Friday to buy grocery store Whole Foods for $13.7 billion. But the pending deal — a record purchase for...

item.title: Amazon shakes up the grocery business with its $13.7-billion deal to buy Whole Foods
item.dc:creator: James F. Peltz, Makeda Easter
item.description:
Amazon revolutionized the sale of books, electronics and other products. Now the online shopping giant is threatening to transform how people buy their food.

Amazon.com Inc. dropped a bombshell Friday on the U.S. grocery industry by agreeing to buy Whole Foods Market Inc. for $13.7 billion, including...

item.title: Meet the man driving the future of Uber and Lyft in the California Legislature
item.dc:creator: Liam Dillon
item.description: A lawmaker who has written a number of bills making it easier for Uber, Lyft and taxis to operate talks about the future of the industry.

item.title: Amid the madness of E3, there's a silent sanctuary for rest (and adult coloring books)
item.dc:creator: Alexa D'Angelo
item.description: E3, the nation’s biggest video game convention, is a place of constant chatter and neon lights, punctuated by the sporadic boom of video game gunfire. It’s a place where thousands elbow their way from booth to booth to try their hand at the hottest games, displayed on giant screens mounted on all...

item.title: Tech start-ups founded by women have twice the number of female employees, study says
item.dc:creator: Makeda Easter
item.description:
Start-ups with at least one female founder wind up building companies where nearly half the staff are women, a new study finds.

With an average of 48% female workers, women-led firms have nearly twice the industry average and outpace some of the nation’s largest tech companies in gender diversity...

item.title: Rape victim sues Uber executives, claims defamation and privacy violations
item.dc:creator: Tracey Lien
item.description:
A Texas woman who was raped by an Uber driver in India in 2014 filed a lawsuit against the ride-hailing company on Thursday, alleging that three current and former executives violated her privacy and defamed her when they accessed and shared her medical records after the attack.

The plaintiff,...

item.title: Uber CEO Travis Kalanick is on leave. Now what?
item.dc:creator: Tracey Lien
item.description: CEOs rarely take a leave of absence unless they're facing a serious problem.

item.title: HuffPost lays off 39 journalists after Yahoo-Verizon deal closes
item.dc:creator: Alexa D'Angelo
item.description:
Thirty-nine journalists at HuffPost were laid off Wednesday as part of Verizon Communications Inc.’s acquisition of Yahoo Inc., according to the union representing the website’s editorial staffers.

The cuts are part of what’s expected to be a 15% staff reduction across Yahoo and the Verizon-owned...

item.title: Have investors allowed tech founders like Uber's Travis Kalanick to grow too powerful?
item.dc:creator: Paresh Dave, James Rufus Koren
item.description:
Silicon Valley knew well the aggressive corporate culture key to Uber's global dominance — and all about that culture's downsides.

Tech workers had seen it in lawsuits filed against the ride-hailing service, candidates turning down jobs at the San Francisco company and those fleeing the firm amid...

item.title: Uber board member resigns after making a joke about women at a company meeting on sexism
item.dc:creator: Tracey Lien
item.description:
Billionaire businessman David Bonderman resigned from Uber’s board of directors Tuesday evening after making a joke about women at a companywide meeting aimed at addressing the harassment of women and unprofessional conduct at the company.

“Today at Uber’s all-hands meeting, I directed a comment...

item.title: Uber CEO pays a price for breaking the rules
item.dc:creator: Tracey Lien
item.description:
Uber was the bad boy of Silicon Valley — a company modeled after brash co-founder and Chief Executive Travis Kalanick that always got into trouble but never seemed to pay the price.

What outsiders saw as arrogant and abrasive behavior — Uber’s fights with and attempts to circumvent regulators and...

item.title: Lyft is turning Uber's missteps into an opportunity
item.dc:creator: David Pierson, Makeda Easter
item.description:
Lyft casts itself as the softer, kinder alternative to Uber. But there’s nothing gentle about the way the country’s second-largest ride-hailing company is capitalizing on its chief rival’s missteps.

While Uber has been engulfed in months of turmoil, capped off Tuesday by the release of the findings...

item.title: Apple is working on self-driving car technology, Tim Cook confirms
item.dc:creator: Samantha Masunaga
item.description:
It’s official: Apple Inc. plans to develop technology that powers self-driving cars — and although it’s a relative latecomer to the increasingly competitive field, analysts say it’s not too late for the tech giant to make its mark there.

In an interview with Bloomberg TV released Tuesday, Chief...

item.title: Yahoo-Verizon deal closes. It's the fall of a giant, end of an era
item.dc:creator: Ethan Baron
item.description:
So long, Yahoo.

Of late it has been a laughingstock, but the company is also remembered fondly for its pioneering contributions to the technology industry and Silicon Valley.

Yahoo Inc.’s tumultuous $4.5-billion sale to Verizon Communications Inc. closed Tuesday, and now the company has disappeared,...

item.title: Storage start-up Clutter wants to get into renting, selling and donating your junk
item.dc:creator: Paresh Dave
item.description: Clutter, a Culver City start-up that picks up, stores and returns goods to people, landed a $64-million investment to bring its storage service to more cities and launch new services.

item.title: Uber’s scandals test the patience of investors — and the public
item.dc:creator: Paresh Dave, David Pierson, Makeda Easter
item.description:
When you're the hottest start-up in the world, investors will give you a pass for burning through as much as $1 billion a quarter. You're growing your business, after all.

But when your company is consumed with complaints of pervasive harassment, mismanagement, executive firings and departures,...

item.title: Uber CEO's right-hand man, Emil Michael, is out. It's unclear if he was fired or quit
item.dc:creator: Tracey Lien
item.description:
Emil Michael, Uber's senior vice president of business and Chief Executive Travis Kalanick’s right-hand man, has left the embattled ride-hailing company, according to an email he sent Monday to employees.

It is unclear whether Michael was fired or resigned. An Uber spokeswoman confirmed that he...
